overview: From 2025-12-18 to 2025-12-19, elizaos/eliza had 3 new PRs (1 merged), 1 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: enhance streaming support in text generation
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

- Streaming support for text generation models
- CLI test runner improvements

# Risks

**Low**. Changes are additive and backward-compatible:
- New streaming API is opt-in via `stream: true` parameter

# Background

## What does this PR do?

Adds streaming support for `TEXT_SMALL` and `TEXT_LARGE` model types, allowing plugins to return text incrementally as it's generated. Also fixes several issues in the CLI test runner.

**Core changes:**
- Add `TextStreamResult` interface with `textStream` async iterable
- Add `stream?: boolean` parameter to `GenerateTextParams`
- Add `supportsStreaming()` type guard for model types
- Update `runtime.useModel()` to handle streaming responses

**CLI test fixes:**
- Fix `startAgents` API signature (array of `{character, plugins}` objects)
- Fix `TestRunner` to exclude `@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap` from plugin detection
- Fix unit test mock function name (`getDefaultCharacter`)

## What kind of change is this?

- Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes require a change to the project documentation:
- Document the new streaming API for plugin developers
- Update model type documentation with streaming support info

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. `packages/core/src/types/model.ts` - New streaming types
2. `packages/core/src/runtime.ts` - Runtime streaming support
3. `packages/cli/src/utils/test-runner.ts` - Bootstrap exclusion fix
```

topPRs.title: refactor(default-message-service): optimize provider handling in MultiStep
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body: # Risks Low. The change only affects the internal execution order of providers in multi-step mode. All providers still execute and return results - just faster. # Background ## What does this PR do? Converts sequential provider execution to parallel execution using `Promise.allSettled` in `runMultiStepCore`. This improves performance when multiple providers need to fetch data simultaneously. **Before:** Providers executed one after another (sequential) **After:** Providers execute in parallel with fault tolerance ## What kind of change is this? Improvements (misc. changes to existing features) # Documentation changes needed? My changes do not require a change to the project documentation. # Testing ## Where should a reviewer start? `packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts` - lines 1053-1107

topPRs.title: fix: bootstrap action/provide format change fix + initPromise fix
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
# Risks

Low, just fixes

# Background

## What does this PR do?

- exposes initPromise so plugins can actually use it (duplicates some of #5718 but smaller and simpler)
- fixes message format (we dropped serverId in favor of messageServerId)

## What kind of change is this?

Improvements (misc. changes to existing features)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?

Why wouldn't we

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Exposes runtime initPromise and updates bootstrap settings/roles to use worldId/messageServerId with decrypted settings from world metadata.
> 
> - **Core**
>   - Add `initPromise` to `IAgentRuntime`.
> - **Bootstrap Plugin**
>   - **Settings action/provider**:
>     - Replace `serverId`/`createUniqueUuid` usage with `worldId` and `messageServerId` where applicable.
>     - Read settings directly from `world.metadata.settings`; decrypt secrets via `getSalt`/`unsaltWorldSettings`.
>     - Persist updates via `runtime.updateWorld` and verify with `getWorldSettings`.
>     - Adjust logs/response payloads to reference `worldId` and updated keys.
>   - **Roles provider**:
>     - Use `room.worldId` to fetch world and roles; remove `serverId` path.
> - **Tests/Mocks**
>   - Add `initPromise` to mock runtimes across test utilities.
>   - Update mocks/returns to use `messageServerId` and `worldId`; remove `serverId` fields.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 6088455e3f63524f25ffe7959ecc099abce15e6a. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: remove reassign runtime.db to individual connection
topPRs.author: nguyennk92
topPRs.body:
# Risks
Low

# Background

## What does this PR do?
Remove unnecessary manual acquire/release client from PgPool. Official docs stated that using PgPool's query directly is perfectly fine: https://node-postgres.com/apis/pool#poolquery
The only exception is when we incorrectly run transaction against PgPool, which is not the case since drizzle already handle that for us

## What kind of change is this?
Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?
We encountered random `Client was closed and not queryable` error when running db query. It only happened within our repository code, never on eliza's core db access. After some digging we found [pg/adapter.ts](https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/blob/df5758034ab9843e913b1cc7b327f4dad8bb2e0f/packages/plugin-sql/src/pg/adapter.ts#L84) assigning runtime.db to individual PoolClient

By re-assign `runtime.db` to a single connection from connection pool, that connection can get dropped even though it was referenced elsewhere, which would cause intermittent error when implementing database access following the Repository pattern guide
